data.event: Plymouth was the site of the colony founded in 1620 by the Pilgrims, passengers of the famous ship the Mayflower.

event.title: served as the capital of Plymouth Colony from its founding in 1620

data.event: Plymouth served as the capital of Plymouth Colony from its founding in 1620 until the colony's merger with the Massachusetts Bay colony in 1691.

event.title: the colony's merger with the Massachusetts Bay colony in 1691

data.event: Plymouth served as the capital of Plymouth Colony from its founding in 1620 until the colony's merger with the Massachusetts Bay colony in 1691.

event.title: continues to be an active port, today

data.event: While it continues to be an active port, today the major industry of Plymouth is tourism.
